messages.title: I want to hear from you
messages.content: Don't risk your job, school, hospital and pension. Labour the only realistic alternative to the Tories in New Forest West.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ensuring every person diagnosed with cancer doesn't wait longer than one week for diagnostic tests by 2010.
Providing a mix of affordable homes to rent and to buy at decent standards.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Caring for the Elderly and Disabled
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Free local bus travel for people over the age of 60 and disabled people.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The leaflet suggests that Labour is the only realistic alternative to the Tories in New Forest West, indicating a tactical situation where voters concerned with an opposition to the Tories may consider voting Labour.

issues.health: Labour is investing in and reforming the NHS to create a health service fit for the needs of 21st century Britain.

housing.content: Providing a mix of affordable homes to rent and to buy at decent standards.

leaflet.personalStatement: Janice has lived in Brockenhurst for 34 years and is married with a daughter. She secured a Law Degree from Bournemouth University for 32 years before retiring.

politicalExperience.role: Labour candidate for the last general election

contactInformation.address: New Forest West Labour Party, 202 Southampton Road, Ringwood, Hampshire, BH24 1JG

endorsements.endorsement: Janice Hurne would make an excellent hardworking, compassionate Member of Parliament for New Forest West.

quotes.text: Janice Hurne would make an excellent hardworking, compassionate Member of Parliament for New Forest West.
quotes.source: John Denham, Former Secretary of State for Communities and Local Government

images.caption: Janice with volunteers from New Forest National Park.
